title: A Formal Correctness Proof of Edmonds' Blossom Shrinking Algorithm
abstract:
We present the first formal correctness proof of Edmonds' blossom shrinking
algorithm for maximum cardinality matching in general graphs. We focus on
formalising the mathematical structures and properties that allow the algorithm
to run in worst-case polynomial running time. We formalise Berge's lemma,
blossoms and their properties, and a mathematical model of the algorithm,
showing that it is totally correct. We provide the first detailed proofs of
many of the facts underlying the algorithm's correctness.
